name: One Of a Kind Christmas Show | 50th Anniversary

address.streetAddress: 100 Princes’ Blvd, Enercare Centre, Exhibition Place, Hall B&C

description:
Since 1975, we have been Canada's favourite holiday tradition, spotlighting the creativity and talent of makers from across the country. This year, we proudly celebrate our 50th anniversary, honouring 
five decades of Canadian craft while looking ahead to an exciting new era.

More than just a holiday marketplace, this is a cultural movement where creativity comes to life. Visitors can shop from over 700 artisans and makers, discover one-of-a-kind treasures and support Canadian small businesses, all while experiencing the festive magic of the season.

This year enjoy a brand-new vintage section, full of nostalgic finds, a European-style Christmas Market with festive gifts, décor, food and drink, an expanded Flavours section for food lovers and special Northwest Territories Pop-Up.

name: 'Tis the Season Community Open House
description:
Celebrate the season at our annual community event! Enjoy festive activities, crafts, entertainment, creative cultural displays, light refreshments and vote for your favourite student artwork from local schools.

Bring a donation to our Warm Wishes Tree and help support local charities: Women's Habitat and Out of the Cold this holiday season. 
We are accepting new items only, including hats, mitts, gloves, scarves, socks, and jackets.

Free. All welcome.

organizer.name: The City of Toronto, Assembly Hall

name: Sasha Mikitenko
description:
Aleksandr Mikitenko is an indie-underground singer-songwriter, musician and translator from Odessa, Ukraine, who became a refugee along with his family because of the Russian-Ukrainian war and eventually settled in Toronto, Canada.

He is best known as a leader of Istok, a band, that for decades has been playing music influenced by forceful alternative rock, impassioned punk and lyrically searching, singer-songwriter folk.  He is also a co-founder of a lo-fi/post-punk duo Libertango along with his wife Marina Polianskaia, who were true followers of the All Wave Philosophy.

name: Tchaikovsky's Swan Lake
description:
Embrace the holiday season with a program that conjures enchanting winter wonderlands. 

Denis Kozhukhin delivers a spellbinding interpretation of Grieg's iconic Piano Concerto, evoking Norway's majestic fjords and snow-capped peaks, while Tchaikovsky's Swan Lake suite captures the shimmering romance and drama of the cherished ballet. Plus, enjoy exciting World Premières from our NextGen Composers.

Enhance your concert experience by arriving early for exquisite performances by the TSO Chamber Soloists, thoughtfully curated by Jonathan Crow.

name: Winter Edition Holiday Art Sale and Auction 2025
description:
Explore limited-edition prints, hand-printed cards, totes, tea towels, calendars, and more. This is the perfect opportunity to find one-of-a-kind holiday gifts. 

All proceeds support Open Studio's operations, enabling us to continue providing affordable and accessible facilities and services to artists in downtown Toronto. We are deeply grateful to the artists who generously donate their work, helping sustain our vibrant printmaking community.

We look forward to celebrating the season with you and sharing the joy of original prints and handmade gifts.

name: The Voice: A Tribute to Frank Sinatra

location.name: Joseph D. Carrier Art Gallery, Columbus Centre

description:
With a career that spanned more than half a century, Frank Sinatra remains a towering figure in the world of music. Iconic hits like "My Way," "Come Fly with Me," and "Fly Me to the Moon" have become enduring classics, shaping the soundscape of early pop, swing, and jazz.

Born to Italian immigrants, Sinatra's remarkable 'rags to riches' journey embodies the vitality and artistic spirit of Italian culture in post-World War II America. His voice, charisma, and influence continue to resonate across generations.

Join us for an unforgettable evening featuring acclaimed jazz vocalist John Alcorn and The Daniel Barnes Trio, as they revisit the timeless songs of "The Voice" and pay tribute to one of the most iconic Italo-American artists of the twentieth century.

name: Canadians In The Round By Michelle Vella
description:
Canadians in the Round is a celebration of who we are, the icons who've shaped our culture, inspired generations and made us proud to call ourselves Canadian.

Each portrait is painted in Michelle Vella's signature Big Eyes style, created on an 8-inch round panel to symbolize unity, connection, and the full-circle feeling of nostalgia. These faces, from musicians and actors to athletes, storytellers, and changemakers, reflect the heart of Canada's creative spirit.

Through bold colour, expression, and playfulness, she aims to capture not just likeness but essence,that spark that made each of these figures unforgettable.

Canadians in the Round brings together 50 portraits, each a window into our shared stories. It's a joyful tribute to the people who've made us laugh, cry, sing, dream and smile.

name: Film Showcase: Best Under Five Minutes
description:
A showcase of the best films with an under five-minute run time.

Followed by QnA with filmmakers in attendance. 

Please visit our website to see our line-up.

name: Mother Country
description:
Here to chronicle the eternal journey home. 

Their songs carry the grit of Southern folk, the sweep of Americana, and the reflective depth of someone who's lived a thousand miles of road. 

The band is founded by singer-songwriter and multi-instrumentalist Benton Roark, whose songs have been described as "backwoods-choir elegance" (The Georgia Straight), "dirty-southern-gothic rock-country-folk" (Discorder Magazine), and "an experience of deep and darkling beauty" (The Austin Chronicle). 

The sound pulls from a wide range of roots: the storytelling spirit of The Band, the cinematic scope of Iron & Wine, the exploratory edge of cosmic country. These threads are woven into something distinctly their own, literary and lived-in, music that asks for your attention and gives back more the deeper you listen.

name: A Very Old Man with Enormous Wings
description:
Adapted from the master of fantastical realism, Gabriel García Márquez's darkly comic tale, brought to the stage for children and adults to share.

In a kitchen, in a theatre, two storytellers and their audience find something remarkable, a very old man with enormous wings. The wise neighbour woman tells us he's an angel.  The priest says he's an imposter.  Pilgrims flock to see him, hoping to be healed by him, hoping to gawp. They leave with something different than what they expected. 

Don't miss this incredible play in Toronto for a short time.

Suitable for guests ages eight and up.

name: Into the Un/Known Art Exhibition
description:
You are invitied to this introspective exhibition, showcasing the evolving works of Master's students from the Interdisciplinary Art, Media and Design program. 
 
What happens when knowledge is shared across cosmological borders? How do beings, speaking in drastically different ways, attempt to communicate? The exhibit brings together an eclectic collection of artists, thinkers and designers, all considering other worldly encounters with unimaginable guests. These encounters become stories, manifested as creations and multimedia installations scattered about the gallery spaces.

name: Book People Social
description:
Meet fellow readers, share stories at mic sessions and connect!

Calling all readers, romantics, and lovers of literature! Join us for a vibrant evening of connection, mingling, and music. Whether you're looking to spark a new friendship, make a professional connection, or find a fellow reader who makes your heart skip a beat, this night is about celebrating the joy of community through stories.

name: Discoveries Vol.7 with Musical Host Jesse Ryan
description:
Hosted and curated by Jesse Ryan, a Trinidadian-born, JUNO Award-nominated saxophonist and leader of the The Kaiso Street Legacy Ensemble, whose main focus is presenting fresh arrangements of music from the golden age of calypso, re-imagined through the lens of modern jazz. 

Rooted in storytelling and cultural preservation, the group bridges eras of Caribbean creativity through dynamic performances and musical excellence. Their current project reimagines the groundbreaking inaugural 1967 concert, Toronto's first major Calypso showcase, bringing new life to the sounds that helped shape the city's cultural identity. 

The ensemble also features Steve Clarke on vocals, Alexis Baro on trumpet, Paul Tarusov on trombone, Ewen Farncombe on piano, Jullian Anderson-Bowes on bass, Amhed Mitchel on drums and Derek Thorne on percussion.

name: 401 Holiday Open House
description:
Start and finish your shopping in over 50 open studios across 5 floors including over 25 artists, 18 galleries, 2 shops, and a licenced café with gourmet pantry. 

Find artwork, books, cards, clothing, jewelry, objects, toys and much more!
